column1: CSCO,Cisco chief urges Obama to curb NSA surveillance activity NEW YORK, May 18 Cisco Systems Inc's  chief executive officer has written a letter to President Barack Obama urging him to curtail government surveillance after evidence circulated showing the National Security Agency had intercepted Cisco equipment, a company spokesman said on Sunday.

GM,UPDATE 2-Johnson Controls divesting auto interiors business to SAIC JV NEW YORK, May 18 Johnson Controls said on Sunday that it has agreed to sell its auto interiors business to a joint venture it is forming with a unit of China's biggest automaker, SAIC Motor Corp.

HPQ,Fast finish lifts Oosthuizen into tie for Byron Nelson lead South African Louis Oosthuizen carded four birdies in the last five holes to surge into a share of the lead with American Brendon Todd after the third round at the $6.9 million HP Byron Nelson Championship in Texas on Saturday.

JCI,Johnson Controls divesting auto interiors business to SAIC JVUPDATE 2-Johnson Controls divesting auto interiors business to SAIC JV NEW YORK, May 18 Johnson Controls said on Sunday that it has agreed to sell its auto interiors business to a joint venture it is forming with a unit of China's biggest automaker, SAIC Motor Corp.  UPDATE 2-Johnson Controls divesting auto interiors business to SAIC JV NEW YORK, May 18 Johnson Controls said on Sunday that it has agreed to sell its auto interiors business to a joint venture it is forming with a unit of China's biggest automaker, SAIC Motor Corp. NEW YORK, May 18 Johnson Controls said on Sunday that it has agreed to sell its auto interiors business to a joint venture it is forming with a unit of China's SAIC Motor Corp.UPDATE 2-Johnson Controls divesting auto interiors business to SAIC JV NEW YORK, May 18 Johnson Controls said on Sunday that it has agreed to sell its auto interiors business to a joint venture it is forming with a unit of China's biggest automaker, SAIC Motor Corp.

LLY,Big Pharma beware: GSK China case may be just the beginning SHANGHAI, May 18 Chinese corruption charges against executives of British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline Plc (GSK) could be just the start of the pharmaceutical industry's problems in its biggest emerging drugs market, according to industry sources in China.

OMC,DEALTALK-Ad deal collapse busts 'merger of equals' myth NEW YORK, May 18 Mergers of equals were largely dead long before ad giant Omnicom Group Inc struck its ill-fated $35 billion deal with rival Publicis Groupe SA .

PFE,AstraZeneca arrays academic assets in Pfizer defenceAstraZeneca arrays academic assets in Pfizer defenseClock ticking for Pfizer to raise AstraZeneca bidPfizer planning to make sweetened bid for AstraZeneca PLC: WSJPfizer planning to make sweetened bid for AstraZeneca PLC: WSJPfizer raises offer for AstraZeneca to 55 pounds a sharePfizer raises bid for AstraZeneca to $117 billion LONDON U.S. drugmaker Pfizer said on Sunday it had raised its offer for British rival AstraZeneca to 69.3 billion pounds ($116.6 billion), or 55 pounds a share, and would walk away if AstraZeneca did not accept it.  Pfizer raises bid for AstraZeneca to $117 billion LONDON U.S. drugmaker Pfizer said on Sunday it had raised its offer for British rival AstraZeneca to 69.3 billion pounds ($116.6 billion), or 55 pounds a share, and would walk away if AstraZeneca did not accept it. LONDON, May 18 U.S. drugmaker Pfizer  said on Sunday it had raised its offer for British rival AstraZeneca to 55 pounds a share and increased the cash element to 45 percent.Pfizer raises bid for AstraZeneca to $117 billion LONDON U.S. drugmaker Pfizer said on Sunday it had raised its offer for British rival AstraZeneca to 69.3 billion pounds ($116.6 billion), or 55 pounds a share, and would walk away if AstraZeneca did not accept it.
